title: Tottenham manager Mauricio Pochettino says 5-0 win is a ‘first step’
text:
Mauricio Pochettino suggested that Tottenham had remained calm in the face of a crisis and been rewarded with a 5-0 win over Red Star Belgrade – a result that has returned control of their Champions League destiny to their own hands.

The Spurs manager rowed over old ground when he talked about how his squad had started late in their preparations for the season because of various circumstances and failed to build the correct dynamic in time.

“In any club, if this situation happens, the most important is to stay calm,” he said. “Don’t make a drama. Always be with a good face, smiling to the problems and being positive. We are going to keep going in the same way and show that the problems are on the pitch, not outside of the pitch.”

He added he would give his players the day off on Wednesday, saying with a smile that it was to “stop all the rumours.” But his main satisfaction was to have seen a more confident performance, after only three wins previously in all competitions this season, and a timely one given they travel to Anfield on Sunday to meet the side who defeated them in last season’s Champions League final.

“I feel good because we are starting to see it’s only time that we need to discover and recover our best feelings and to build the confidence,” Pochettino said. “We need to go step by step and be solid again. This was the first step. We are in a better position in this competition now. It’s in our hands.”

The manager was asked whether he was now happy with the dynamic among his players. “I’m not happy and I’m not unhappy,” he replied. “I am facing the situation how it is. I am very realistic. At the same time, I think it’s a massive experience for us. It’s a great moment to grow, to be more mature. This type of situation must help us to be stronger in the future, for sure.”
description: Harry Kane and Son Heung-min scored doubles and Érik Lamela also found the net as Tottenham beat Red Star Belgrade 5-0 at home to go second in Champions League Group B
